title: Perth, Scotland
summary: Perth (/ˈpɜːrθ/ (listen); Scottish Gaelic: Peairt [pʰɛrˠʃtʲ])[3][4] is a city in central Scotland, on the banks of the River Tay. It is the administrative centre of Perth and Kinross council area and the historic county town of Perthshire. It had a population of about 47,180 in 2012.[5]
